New Records: Josh Hader's consecutive saves streak snapped at 29 games in a row
The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, tying the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve hit a game-winning double off the left-field wall in the bottom of the ninth inning
Framber Valdez threw seven no-hit innings
Paul DeJong tied the game with a two-run homer in the top of the ninth inning
Jake Meyers scored the winning run from first base on Altuve's double
Bryan Abreu gave up a two-out single to break up the no-hit bid in the eighth inning
Royals tied the game in the ninth on a two-run homer by DeJong off Josh Hader
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada praised Jose Altuve's performance, saying 'He always finds a way to wow us'
Espada reflected on Framber Valdez's performance, highlighting his efficiency and composure
Espada commented on Josh Hader's performance, acknowledging his outstanding streak of 29 consecutive saves
Miscellaneous Highlights: Framber Valdez relied heavily on his sinker and curveball, inducing 23 swings and nine whiffs with his curveball
Valdez's performance included a 2.65 ERA, 1.03 WHIP, and 11 quality starts in 17 starts since May 27
